ags:resource.dc:title: Impacts of the financial crisis on Greek small business owners behavior and decision-making [Thesis (M.Sc.)]

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The financial recession has hit Greece as hard as any other country in the Eurozone. The state's economy is based more heavily on micro-firms than any of the other EU economies. These two facts alone are what make studying the effects of this extraordinary event so substantial. A survey containing 29 questions was conducted among nearly 400 small business owners and managers. Questionnaires were completed through personal, online, and telephone interviews. Unlike most researches done in the area emphasizing financial indicators, this one aims to identify what impacts the financial crisis is having on businessmen's attitude towards their management strategies, uses of cooperation, advertising presence, etc., Some interesting results were shown in the comparative analysis between managers and owners in the direction of determining the psychological effects of the crisis in their rationality, decision-making, confidence and intuition. Furthermore, the research measures how companies in different areas of sector have changed their way of doing business and if they have equal opportunities in terms of reducing costs of inputs. The observations made have shown that the Greek small business sector has its own answer for the crisis and its challenges. However, there are still numerous opportunities for running rational strategies against serious financial downturns.
